channel.title: Reward of Rep - Science Test Question please! Urgent D:
channel.description: What is the first Jovian Planet in our Galaxy?

item.title: Reward of Rep - Science Test Question please! Urgent D:
item.dc:creator: @Broken_Britain Broken Britain
item.description:
@Broken_Britain wrote:

Niall is right. It’s almost a trick question. You would first assume Jupiter but then if you re-think the question the keyword there is Galaxy, not Solar System, therefore you cannot answer this question with any accuracy at all.

Read full topic
item.source: Reward of Rep - Science Test Question please! Urgent D:

item.title: Reward of Rep - Science Test Question please! Urgent D:
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Ambokile:

The question asked which was the first Jovian planet in the galaxy. He said that Jupiter is.

first in the galaxy WHAT

it doesn’t say first in the galaxy relative to the centre of the galaxy, it doesn’t say first in the galaxy to be discovered, for all we know the question could mean first in the galaxy relative to the andromeda galaxy

given that our methods for confirming a planets existence, and we only know on the order of a few thousand planets, asking what the first jovian planet in the galaxy relative to the centre would be a bit stupid since new information could come out next week making that whole exercise redundant

Ambokile:

Our solar system is not the closest to the centre of the galaxy, therefore jupiter isnt

again, “What is the first Jovian Planet in our Galaxy?”, it doesn’t say in relation to the centre of the galaxy and such an exercise would be stupid because we really, really can’t say with certainty what the answer is

Read full topic

[/quote]

Yes, I read that above. Your point is? :P[/quote]

Our solar system is not the closest to the centre of the galaxy, therefore jupiter isnt

Jupiter is the first in order of the planets. Following Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune.
[/quote]
R
The sun is not the centre of the galaxy[/quote]

item.title: Reward of Rep - Science Test Question please! Urgent D:
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:8, topic:462332”]assuming you no longer need the answer, this is just for future reference

assuming you don’t know what a ‘jovian planet’ is, you would consult google or wikipedia, which state that a jovian planet is a gas giant type of planet, with that you can now answer the question

but the question doesn’t make any sense, “the first gas giant planet in the galaxy” first at what? first discovered gas giant? first in relation to our star, or first in relation to the centre of the galaxy? you should tell your astronomy teacher that the question lacks any context[/quote]

Your face lacks context.

Read full topic

but the question doesn’t make any sense, “the first gas giant planet in the galaxy” first at what? first discovered gas giant? first in relation to our star, or first in relation to the centre of the galaxy? you should tell your astronomy teacher that the question lacks any context
